abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Refinery Energy
            Conservation and Modernization Project for Pakistan was
            satisfactory. The project achieved its major objectives, its
            impact on institutional development has been substantial,
            sustainability is likely, and both the Bank and Borrower
            performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be learned
            from this project. First, there is a need for a much higher
            degree of autonomy to parastatals and trust in key
            officials. Overall, the state-owned refineries can perform
            better if given autonomy and the MOP and MPNR's
            monitoring role is confined to ensuring that the refineries
            stay within the policy guidelines defined by the Government.
            Second, in light of the substantial investments required to
            reconfigure the NRL in the medium term, the GOP should
            seriously consider developing a strategy for the involvement
            of the private sector by appropriating changes in the
            ownership structure of the NRL. Finally, the Bank should pay
            more attention to the evaluation of the implementing
            agency's authority and capability when designing and
            appraising a project.
